Name: Alex Pedersen
Summary: Alex Pedersen was most recently a manager at a company that helps to preserve affordable housing. He previously worked for former Councilmember Tim Burgess.
Problem: Residents and local businesses want and deserve more accountability from their City Council.

Name: Beth Mountsier
Summary: Beth Mountsier is a local-government policy expert who spent more than 15 years as a King County Council analyst. She co-chairs the University Heights Community center board.
Occupation: Redmond transit project manager and analyst
Problem: Critical leadership and technical expertise on housing (including affordable), land use and zoning that will create a more livable city for all

Name: Cathy Tuttle
Summary: Cathy Tuttle worked for Seattle Parks and Recreation and then founded Seattle Neighborhood Greenways, which advocates for safer streets.
Problem: Including all voices in how we grow and change.
Endorsements: Greg Cummins, Real Change Vendor*, Ed Lazowska, UW Computer Science & Engineering*, Inga Manskopf, Ravenna-Bryant Community Association President*

Name: Emily Myers
Summary: Emily Myers is a Ph.D. candidate at the University of Washington, where she investigates Parkinson's disease. She's also a leader at a union for academic workers.
Committee: Gender Equity, Safe Communities, New Americans and Education
Problem: Economic inequality and all the various intersections that economic inequality encompasses

Name: Ethan Hunter
Summary: Ethan Hunter says he would bring a fresh perspective to City Hall. He says Seattle should tax companies like Amazon to help poor and working-class residents.
Problem: The skyrocketing price of housing and the homeless population needs immediate attention.

Name: Frank Krueger
Summary: Frank Krueger says rent hikes like the increase that forced him to move his small software-development business off the Ave are Seattle's most important problem.
Committee: Human Services, Equitable Development and Renter Rights
Problem: Inflation of housing and rent prices

Name: Heidi Stuber
Summary: Heidi Stuber is the strategic director for a vacation-rental company. She says her experiences as a businesswoman and mother would help the council.
Committee: Gender Equity, Safe Communities, New Americans and Education
Endorsements: First Ask, Arzu Forough: CEO of Washington Autism Alliance & Advocacy

Name: Joshua Newman
Summary: Joshua Newman is a union engineer who's been active with biking- and transit-advocacy organizations. He's served on the Maple Leaf Community Council.

Name: Sasha Anderson
Summary: Sasha Anderson directs a high-school mentoring program and says she'd represent renters on the council.
Occupation: Big Brothers Big Sisters program coordinator
Committee: Gender Equity, Safe Communities, New Americans and Education

Name: Shaun Scott
Summary: Shaun Scott is a writer and an organizer with the Democratic Socialists of America. He says Seattle should tax the rich and allow denser housing.
Problem: A regressive tax climate that balances budgets on the backs of working people, students and vulnerable homeowners
Endorsements: Seattle Democratic Socialists of America, Cary Moon
